snippet: Being an “incorrigible rogue” is no longer against the law in Britain.
abstract: Great Britain's Ministry of Justice says being an 'incorrigible rogue' is one of more than 300 obsolete offense that have been scrapped over the past year.
lead_paragraph: Being an “incorrigible rogue” is no longer against the law in Britain.

headline.main: Britain: Rogues Are Outlaws No More
headline.print_headline: Britain: Rogues Are Outlaws No More
